Introduction

Kim Sung Kyu, also known simply as Sung Kyu, is a South Korean singer-songwriter and actor under BILLIONS. He is the leader and main vocalist of the boy group INFINITE. He made his solo debut on November 19, 2012, with the release of his mini album Another Me.

Sung Kyu debuted as a member of INFINITE on June 9, 2010, with their first mini album, First Invasion. Two years later, on November 19, 2012, he launched his solo career with Another Me, establishing himself as a versatile artist outside of group activities.

After more than a decade with Woollim Entertainment, Sung Kyu departed from the agency on March 6, 2021, following the expiration of his contract. His final release under Woollim was the single album Won't Forget You. On June 14 of the same year, he signed a contract with Double H TNE, marking a new chapter in his career.

Under his new agency, he released his fourth mini album, Savior, on April 22, 2022. Later that year, on November 7, he announced a special single album, Dear My Fan, in celebration of his 10th solo debut anniversary, which was officially released on November 13. Continuing his musical journey, he unveiled his fifth mini album, 2023 S/S Collection, on June 28, 2023. In mid-2024, Sung Kyu transitioned to a new agency, officially signing with BILLIONS on July 16.

Regarding his personal life, Sung Kyu pursued his studies at Dae Kyung University. He enlisted for mandatory military service on May 14, 2018, where he participated in the military musical productions Shinheung Military Academy and Return: The Promise of the Day. During his service, he also recorded a special song alongside other enlisted idols, including Key, Xiumin, Jo Kwon, Jeon Jinwoon, Yoon Jisung, and Changsub. He completed his military service and was discharged on January 8, 2020, receiving an award of appreciation for his contributions.
